Package a5

Class AbstractStringWrapper

java.lang.Object
a5.AbstractStringWrapper
Direct Known Subclasses:
SpacesWrapper, WidthWrapper
public abstract class AbstractStringWrapper extends Object
Abstract base class for classes that try to wrap strings to a desired maximum width. Wrapping a string breaks the string into separate lines so that the length of each line is (ideally) less than or equal to some user-defined maximum width.

This class provides a skeletal implementation of a string wrapping class. It provides storage for the string that is being wrapped, the desired maximum width of each line, and the list of lines comprising the wrapped string.

Subclasses should override the wrap() method which implements a string wrapping strategy.

    • AbstractStringWrapper

      public AbstractStringWrapper(String toWrap, int targetWidth)
      Initializes this StringWrapper with a string to wrap and the desired maximum wrapped line width.
      Parameters:
      toWrap - the string to wrap
      targetWidth - the desired maximum width of each line of the wrapped string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if targetWidth is less than 1

  • Method Details

    • width

      public int width()
      Returns the desired maximum width of each line of the wrapped string.
      Returns:
      the desired maximum width of each line of the wrapped string

    • width

      public void width(int maxWidth)
      Sets the desired maximum width of each line of the wrapped string. The string is not automatically re-wrapped to the new width.

      The caller should call wrap(String) or wrap() after calling this method to cause the string to be re-wrapped.

      Parameters:
      maxWidth - the desired maximum width of each line of the wrapped string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if targetWidth is less than 1

    • getLines

      public List<String> getLines()
      Returns a list containing the lines of the wrapped string.

      The caller should call wrap(String) or wrap() before calling this method to cause the string to be wrapped, otherwise an empty list may be returned.

      Returns:
      a list containing the lines of the wrapped string, or an empty list if the string has not been wrapped yet

    • wrap

      public void wrap(String s)
      Changes the string to be wrapped to the specified string, and wraps the string.
      Parameters:
      s - the string to be wrapped

    • wrap

      public abstract void wrap()
      Wraps the string breaking it into separate lines. Subclasses will implement different strategies for wrapping strings and should try to ensure that the length of each line is less than or equal to the desired maximum width; however, not all wrapping strategies will be able to guarantee that the length of all lines of the wrapped string are less than or equal to the desired maximum width.

      When overriding this method, subclasses should first clear this object's list of strings that hold the wrapped lines of text. Then, subclasses should wrap the the string adding the wrapped lines to this object's list.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the string that is being wrapped. To get the wrapped version of the string, callers should use invalid input: '{@code getLines()). @return the string that is being wrapped'
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
